activities.loc: Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level Hearing Room - LC300

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Lee Canady

8:41 AM Defendant Charles Lee Canady in court.  Attorney Gerardo Antonio De Los Santos Jr in court for Charles Lee Canady.  Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Gerardo Antonio De Los Santos Jr

9:29 AM Defendant Charles Lee Canady in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
SPD has not yet appointed counsel for defendant.  Defendant states he is employed.
BTC:  Court appoints counsel for defendant.  Repay at $50/month commencing in 60 days.  Finding of good cause to waive time limits.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Charles Lee Canady
Current: 4043 Marquette Dr., Racine, WI 53402 United States  (Effective: 08-16-2022)
Prior: 1541 Grange Ave, Racine, WI 53405

9:24 AM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles Lee Canady in court, in custody. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have an attorney yet.  Defendant needs more time to retain counsel/time for SPD to appoint counsel. 
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive at all. No contact with the co-defendant M.S. No contact with the victim I.K (person, property, residence or family).

1:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles Lee Canady appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared by video for Charles Lee Canady. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
